instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, & <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> both do not detect WI-FI Card
threads.message:
hey guys, please if anyone can help, i have 2 logic boards, 1 - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, 1 - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, they both have no liquid damage, never been repaired, only problem is they do not read wifi, does not detect WI-FI, any ideas where i should start

i have already tried new known wifi cards,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, & <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> both do not detect WI-FI Card
threads.message:
No hardware installed, or which error you get?
Check first <CHIP>U3450</CHIP> and L3404.
Post <CHIP>U3440</CHIP> voltages.
Does bluetooth work?
Also check L3401/70/71/73/74.
